body_html:
I created the model as you suggested,

class BaseModel(Model):
    def __init__(self, num_features):
        super(BaseModel, self).__init__(name='bcnn')

        self.dense1 = Dense(12, activation=tf.nn.relu)
        self.dense2 = Dense(12, activation=tf.nn.relu)
        self.dense3 = Dense(num_features, activation=None)

    def call(self, inputs):
        x = self.dense1(inputs)
        x = self.dense2(x)
        return self.dense3(x)
model = BaseModel(num_features=48)
model.compile(loss='mse',optimizer='adam',metrics=['mae'])

But I am getting the same error as before.

body:
I created the model as you suggested, 
```
class BaseModel(Model):
    def __init__(self, num_features):
        super(BaseModel, self).__init__(name='bcnn')

        self.dense1 = Dense(12, activation=tf.nn.relu)
        self.dense2 = Dense(12, activation=tf.nn.relu)
        self.dense3 = Dense(num_features, activation=None)

    def call(self, inputs):
        x = self.dense1(inputs)
        x = self.dense2(x)
        return self.dense3(x)
model = BaseModel(num_features=48)
model.compile(loss='mse',optimizer='adam',metrics=['mae'])
```
But I am getting the same error as before.
